column2: quī ambulant in lēge Dominī. ^ Blessed are the undefiled in the way
column3: who walk in the law of the Lord.

column2: quī scrūtantur testimōnia ejus; in tōtō corde exquīrent eum. ^ Blessed are they that search his testimonies; they will seek him with their whole heart.

column1: 3 ^ Nōn enim quī operantur inīquitātem in viīs ejus ambulāvērunt. ^ For they that work iniquity have not walked in his ways.
4 ^ Tū mandāvistī mandāta tua custōdīrī nimis. ^ Thou hast commanded thy commandments to be kept most diligently.
5 ^ Utinam dīrigantur viae meae ad custōdiendās jūstificātiōnēs tuās. ^ O that my ways may be directed to keep thy justifications.

column2: quum perspexerō in omnibus mandātīs tuīs. ^ Then shall I not be confounded
column3: when I shall look into all thy commandments.

column2: in eō quod didicī jūdicia jūstitiae tuae. ^ I will praise thee with uprightness of heart
column3: when I shall have learned the judgments of thy justice.

column1: 8 ^ Jūstificātiōnēs tuās custōdiem; nōn mē dērelinquās usquequāque. ^ I will keep thy justifications; do not thou utterly forsake me.
9 ^ In quō corrigit adolēscentior viam suam? In custōdiendō sermōnēs tuōs. ^ By what doth a young man correct his way? By observing thy words.
10 ^ In tōtō corde meō exquīsīvī tē; nē repellās mē ā mandātīs tuīs. ^ With my whole heart have I sought after thee; let me not stray from thy commandments.
11 ^ In corde meō abscondī ēloquia tua
column2: ut nōn peccem tibi. ^ Thy words have I hidden in my heart
column3: that I may not sin against thee.

column1: 12 ^ Benedictus es Domine; docē mē jūstificātiōnēs tuās. ^ Blessed art thou
column2: O Lord; teach me thy justifications.

column1: 13 ^ In labiīs meīs prōnūntiāvī omnia jūdicia ōris tuī. ^ With my lips I have pronounced all the judgments of thy mouth.
14 ^ In viā testimōniōrum tuōrum dēlectātus sum
column2: sīcut in omnibus dīvitiīs. ^ I have been delighted in the way of thy testimonies
column3: as in all riches.

column2: et consīderābō viās tuās. ^ I will meditate on thy commandments
column3: and I will consider thy ways.

column1: 16 ^ In jūstificātiōnibus tuīs meditābor; nōn oblīvīscer sermōnēs tuōs. ^ I will think of thy justifications; I will not forget thy words.

column2: et custōdiem sermōnēs tuōs. ^ Give bountifully to thy servant; enliven me
column3: and I shall keep thy words.

column2: et consīderābō mīrābilia dē lēge tuā. ^ Open thou my eyes
column3: and I will consider the wondrous things of thy law.

column1: 19 ^ Incola egō sum in terrā; nōn abscondās ā mē mandāta tua. ^ I am a sojourner on the earth; do not hide thy commandments from me.
20 ^ Concupīvit anima mea dēsīderāre jūstificātiōnēs tuās in omnī tempore. ^ My soul hath coveted to long for thy justifications at all times.
21 ^ Increpāvistī superbōs; maledictī quī dēclīnant ā mandātīs tuīs. ^ Thou hast rebuked the proud; they are cursed who decline from thy commandments.

column2: et contemptum
column3: quia testimōnia tua exquīsīvī. ^ Remove from me reproach and contempt
column4: because I have sought after thy testimonies.

column2: et adversum mē loquēbantur; servus autem tuus exercēbātur in jūstificātiōnibus tuīs. ^ For princes sat
column3: and spoke against me; yet thy servant was employed in thy justifications.

column1: 24 ^ Nam et testimōnia tua meditātiō mea est
column2: et consilium meum jūstificātiōnēs tuae. ^ For thy testimonies are my meditation
column3: and thy justifications my counsel.

column1: 25 ^ Adhaesit pavīmentō anima mea; vīvificā mē secundum verbum tuum. ^ My soul hath cleaved to the pavement; quicken thou me according to thy word.

column2: et exaudīvistī mē; docē mē jūstificātiōnēs tuās. ^ I have declared my ways
column3: and thou hast heard me; teach me thy justifications.

column2: et exercēbor in mīrābilibus tuīs. ^ Make me to understand the way of thy justifications
column3: and I shall be exercised in thy wondrous works.

column1: 28 ^ Dormītāvit anima mea prae taediō; confirmā mē in verbīs tuīs. ^ My soul hath slumbered through heaviness; strengthen thou me in thy words.

column2: et dē lēge tuā miserēre meī. ^ Remove from me the way of iniquity
column3: and out of thy law have mercy on me.

column1: 30 ^ Viam vēritātis ēlēgī; jūdicia tua nōn sum oblītus. ^ I have chosen the way of truth; thy judgments I have not forgotten.

column2: Domine; nōlī mē confundere. ^ I have stuck to thy testimonies
column3: O Lord; put me not to shame.

column2: quum dīlātāvistī cor meum. ^ I have run the way of thy commandments
column3: when thou didst enlarge my heart.

column2: Domine
column3: viam jūstificātiōnum tuārum
column4: et exquīram eam semper. ^ Set for me a law
column5: O Lord
column7: and I will always seek after it.

column2: et scrūtābor lēgem tuam
column3: et custōdiem illam in tōtō corde meō. ^ Give me understanding
column4: and I will search thy law
column5: and I will keep it with my whole heart.

column1: 35 ^ Dēdūc mē in sēmitam mandātōrum tuōrum
column2: quia ipsam voluī. ^ Lead me into the path of thy commandments
column3: for I have desired it.

column1: 36 ^ Inclīnā cor meum in testimōnia tua
column2: et nōn in avāritiam. ^ Incline my heart into thy testimonies
column3: and not to covetousness.

column1: 37 ^ Āverte oculōs meōs nē videant vānitātem; in viā tuā vīvificā mē. ^ Turn away my eyes that they may not behold vanity; quicken me in thy way.
38 ^ Statue servō tuō ēloquium tuum in timōre tuō. ^ Establish thy word to thy servant in thy fear.
39 ^ Amputā opprobrium meum quod suspicātus sum
column2: quia jūdicia tua jūcunda. ^ Turn away my reproach which I have apprehended
column3: for thy judgments are delightful.

column1: 40 ^ Ecce concupīvī mandāta tua; in aequitāte tuā vīvificā mē. ^ Behold I have longed after thy precepts; quicken me in thy justice.
41 ^ Et veniat super mē misericordia tua
column2: Domine; salūtāre tuum secundum ēloquium tuum. ^ And let thy mercy also come upon me
column3: O Lord; thy salvation according to thy word.

column2: quia spērāvī in sermōnibus tuīs. ^ And I shall answer them that reproach me in any thing; that I have trusted in thy words.

column1: 43 ^ Et nē auferās dē ōre meō verbum vēritātis usquequāque
column2: quia in jūdiciīs tuīs superspērāvī. ^ And take not thou the word of truth utterly out of my mouth
column3: for in thy words I have hoped exceedingly.

column2: in saeculum et in saeculum saeculī. ^ And I shall always keep thy law
column3: for ever and for ever and ever.

column2: quia mandāta tua exquīsīvī. ^ And I walked at large
column3: because I have sought after thy commandments.

column1: 46 ^ Et loquēbar in testimōniīs tuīs in conspectū rēgum
column2: et nōn confundēbar. ^ And I spoke of thy testimonies before kings
column3: and I was not ashamed.

column2: quae dīlēxī. ^ And I meditated on thy commandments
column3: which I loved.

column1: 48 ^ Et levāvī manūs meās ad mandāta tua
column2: quae dīlēxī
column3: et exercēbar in jūstificātiōnibus tuīs. ^ And I lifted up my hands to thy commandments
column5: and I was exercised in thy justifications.

column1: 49 ^ Memor estō verbī tuī servō tuō
column2: in quō mihi spem dedistī. ^ Be thou mindful of thy word to thy servant
column3: in which thou hast given me hope.

column1: 50 ^ Haec mē consōlāta est in humilitāte meā
column2: quia ēloquium tuum vīvificāvit mē. ^ This hath comforted me in my humiliation
column3: because thy word hath enlivened me.

column2: ā lēge autem tua nōn dēclīnāvī. ^ The proud did iniquitously altogether
column3: but I declined not from thy law.

column1: 52 ^ Memor fuī jūdiciōrum tuōrum ā saeculō Domine
column2: et consōlātus sum. ^ I remembered
column3: O Lord
column5: and I was comforted.

column2: prō peccātōribus dērelinquentibus lēgem tuam. ^ A fainting hath taken hold of me
column3: because of the wicked that forsake thy law.

column1: 54 ^ Cantābilēs mihi erant jūstificātiōnēs tuae in locō peregrīnātiōnis meae. ^ Thy justifications were the subject of my song
column2: in the place of my pilgrimage.

column1: 55 ^ Memor fuī nocte nōminis tuī Domine
column2: et custōdīvī lēgem tuam. ^ In the night I have remembered thy name
column3: O Lord

column2: quia jūstificātiōnēs tuās exquīsīvī. ^ This happened to me
column3: because I sought after thy justifications.

column2: Domine; dīxī custōdīre lēgem tuam. ^ My portion
column3: O Lord; I have said I would keep thy law.

column1: 58 ^ Dēprecātus sum faciem tuam in tōtō corde meō; miserēre meī secundum ēloquium tuum. ^ I entreated thy face with all my heart; have mercy on me according to thy word.

column2: et convertī pedēs meōs in testimōnia tua. ^ I have thought on my ways
column3: and turned my feet unto thy testimonies.

column2: et nōn sum turbātus
column3: ut custōdiam mandāta tua. ^ I am ready
column5: that I may keep thy commandments.

column2: et lēgem tuam nōn sum oblītus. ^ The cords of the wicked have encompassed me
column3: but I have not forgotten thy law.

column2: ad confitendum tibi super jūdicia jūstificātiōnis tuae. ^ I rose at midnight to give praise to thee
column3: for the judgments of thy justification.

column1: 63 ^ Particeps egō sum omnium timentium tē
column2: et custōdientium mandāta tua. ^ I am a partaker with all them that fear thee
column3: and that keep thy commandments.

column2: Domine
column3: plēna est terra; jūstificātiōnēs tuās docē mē. ^ The earth
column5: is full of thy mercy; teach me thy justifications.

column2: Domine
column3: secundum verbum tuum. ^ Thou hast done well with thy servant
column5: according to thy word.

column1: 66 ^ Bonitātem et disciplīnam et scientiam docē mē
column2: quia mandātīs tuīs crēdidī. ^ Teach me goodness and discipline and knowledge
column3: for I have believed thy commandments.

column1: 67 ^ Priusquam humiliārer egō dēlīquī; proptereā ēloquium tuum custōdīvī. ^ Before I was humbled I offended; therefore have I kept thy word.

column2: et in bonitāte tuā docē mē jūstificātiōnēs tuās. ^ Thou art good
column3: and in thy goodness teach me thy justifications.

column1: 69 ^ Multiplicāta est super mē inīquitās superbōrum; egō autem in tōtō corde meō scrūtābor mandāta tua. ^ The iniquity of the proud hath been multiplied over me; but I will seek thy commandments with my whole heart.
70 ^ Coāgulātum est sīcut lac cor eōrum; egō vērō lēgem tuam meditātus sum. ^ Their heart is curdled like milk; but I have meditated on thy law.

column2: ut discam jūstificātiōnēs tuās. ^ It is good for me that thou hast humbled me
column3: that I may learn thy justifications.

column2: super millia aurī et argentī. ^ The law of thy mouth is good to me
column3: above thousands of gold and silver.

column2: et plasmāvērunt mē; dā mihi intellēctum
column3: et discam mandāta tua. ^ Thy hands have made me and formed me; give me understanding
column4: and I will learn thy commandments.

column2: et laetābuntur
column3: quia in verba tua superspērāvī. ^ They that fear thee shall see me
column5: because I have greatly hoped in thy words.

column2: Domine
column3: quia aequitās jūdicia tua
column4: et in vēritāte tuā humiliāvistī mē. ^ I know
column5: O Lord
column7: and in thy truth thou hast humbled me.

column1: 76 ^ Fīat misericordia tua ut consōlētur mē
column2: secundum ēloquium tuum servō tuō. ^ O let thy mercy be for my comfort
column3: according to thy word unto thy servant.

column2: et vīvam
column3: quia lēx tua meditātiō mea est. ^ Let thy tender mercies come unto me
column5: for thy law is my meditation.

column2: quia injūstē inīquitātem fēcērunt in mē; egō autem exercēbor in mandātīs tuīs. ^ Let the proud be ashamed
column3: because they have done unjustly towards me; but I will be employed in thy commandments.

column2: et quī nōvērunt testimōnia tua. ^ Let them that fear thee turn to me
column3: and they that know thy testimonies.

column1: 80 ^ Fīat cor meum immaculātum in jūstificātiōnibus tuīs
column2: ut nōn confundar. ^ Let my heart be undefiled in thy justifications
column3: that I may not be confounded.

column1: 81 ^ Dēfēcit in salūtāre tuum anima mea
column2: et in verbum tuum superspērāvī. ^ My soul hath fainted after thy salvation
column3: and in thy word I have very much hoped.

column1: 82 ^ Dēfēcērunt oculī meī in ēloquium tuum
column2: dīcentēs: Quandō consōlāberis mē? ^ My eyes have failed for thy word
column3: saying: When wilt thou comfort me?

column1: 83 ^ Quia factus sum sīcut uter in pruīnā; jūstificātiōnēs tuās nōn sum oblītus. ^ For I am become like a bottle in the frost; I have not forgotten thy justifications.
84 ^ Quot sunt diēs servī tuī? Quandō faciēs dē persequentibus mē jūdicium? ^ How many are the days of thy servant? When wilt thou execute judgment on them that persecute me?

column2: sed nōn ut lēx tua. ^ The wicked have told me fables
column3: but not as thy law.

column1: 86 ^ Omnia mandāta tua vēritās; inīquē persecūtī sunt mē; adjuvā mē. ^ All thy statutes are truth; they have persecuted me unjustly
column2: do thou help me.

column1: 87 ^ Paulō minus consummāvērunt mē in terrā; egō autem nōn dērelīquī mandāta tua. ^ They had almost made an end of me upon earth; but I have not forsaken thy commandments.

column2: et custōdiem testimōnia ōris tuī. ^ Quicken thou me according to thy mercy
column3: and I shall keep the testimonies of thy mouth.

column2: Domine
column3: verbum tuum permanet in caelō. ^ For ever
column5: thy word standeth firm in heaven.

column1: 90 ^ In generātiōnem et generātiōnem vēritās tua; fundāvistī terram
column2: et permanet. ^ Thy truth unto all generations; thou hast founded the earth
column3: and it continueth.

column2: quoniam omnia serviunt tibi. ^ By thy ordinance the day goeth on
column3: for all things serve thee.

column1: 92 ^ Nisi quod lēx tua meditātiō mea est
column2: tunc forte perīvissem in humilitāte meā. ^ Unless thy law had been my meditation
column3: I had then perhaps perished in my abjection.

column1: 93 ^ In aeternum nōn oblīvīscer jūstificātiōnēs tuās
column2: quia in ipsīs vīvificāvistī mē. ^ Thy justifications I will never forget
column3: for by them thou hast given me life.

column1: 94 ^ Tuus sum egō; salvum mē fac
column2: quoniam jūstificātiōnēs tuās exquīsīvī. ^ I am thine; save thou me
column3: for I have sought thy justifications.

column1: 95 ^ Mē expectāvērunt peccātōrēs ut perderent mē; testimōnia tua intellēxī. ^ The wicked have waited for me to destroy me; I have understood thy testimonies.

column2: lātum mandātum tuum nimis. ^ I have seen an end of all perfection; thy commandment is exceeding broad.
Domine; tōtā diē meditātiō mea est. ^ O how have I loved thy law
column3: O Lord; it is my meditation all the day.

column1: 98 ^ Super inimīcōs meōs prūdentem mē fēcistī mandātō tuō
column2: quia in aeternum mihi est. ^ Through thy commandment
column3: thou hast made me wiser than my enemies
column4: for it is ever with me.

column2: quia testimōnia tua meditātiō mea est. ^ I have understood more than all my teachers
column3: because thy testimonies are my meditation.

column2: quia mandāta tua quaesīvī. ^ I have had understanding above ancients
column3: because I have sought thy commandments.

column1: 101 ^ Ab omnī viā malā prohibuī pedēs meōs
column2: ut custōdiam verba tua. ^ I have restrained my feet from every evil way
column3: that I may keep thy words.

column2: quia tū lēgem posuistī mihi. ^ I have not declined from thy judgments
column3: because thou hast set me a law.

column1: 103 ^ Quam dulcia faucibus meīs ēloquia tua
column2: super mel ōrī meō. ^ How sweet are thy words to my palate
column3: more than honey to my mouth.

column1: 104 ^ Ā mandātīs tuīs intellēxī; proptereā ōdīvī omnem viam inīquitātis. ^ By thy commandments I have had understanding
column2: therefore have I hated every way of iniquity.
et lūmen sēmitīs meīs. ^ Thy word is a lamp to my feet
column3: and a light to my paths.

column1: 106 ^ Jūrāvī et statuī custōdīre jūdicia jūstitiae tuae. ^ I have sworn and am determined to keep the judgments of thy justice.

column2: Domine; vīvificā mē secundum verbum tuum. ^ I have been humbled exceedingly
column3: O Lord; quicken thou me according to thy word.

column2: Domine
column3: et jūdicia tua docē mē. ^ The free offerings of my mouth make acceptable
column5: and teach me thy judgments.

column1: 109 ^ Anima mea in manibus meīs semper
column2: et lēgem tuam nōn sum oblītus. ^ My soul is continually in my hands
column3: and I have not forgotten thy law.

column2: et dē mandātīs tuīs nōn errāvī. ^ Sinners have laid a snare for me
column3: but I have not erred from thy precepts.

column1: 111 ^ Hērēditāte acquīsīvī testimōnia tua in aeternum
column2: quia exsultātiō cordis meī sunt. ^ I have purchased thy testimonies for an inheritance for ever
column3: because they are the joy of my heart.

column1: 112 ^ Inclīnāvī cor meum ad faciendās jūstificātiōnēs tuās in aeternum
column2: propter retribūtiōnem. ^ I have inclined my heart to do thy justifications for ever
column3: for the reward.

column2: et lēgem tuam dīlēxī. ^ I regarded the unjust transgressors with hated
column3: and have loved thy law.

column1: 114 ^ Adjūtor et susceptor meus es tū
column2: et in verbum tuum superspērāvī. ^ Thou art my helper and my protector
column3: and in thy word I have greatly hoped.

column2: malignī
column3: et scrūtābor mandāta Deī meī. ^ Depart from me
column5: and I will search the commandments of my God.

column2: et vīvam
column3: et nōn confundās mē ab expectātiōne meā. ^ Uphold me according to thy word
column5: and let me not be confounded in my expectation.

column2: et salvus erō
column3: et meditābor in jūstificātiōnibus tuīs semper. ^ Help me
column5: and I will meditate always on thy justifications.

column1: 118 ^ Sprēvistī omnēs discēdentēs ā jūdiciīs tuīs
column2: quia injūsta cōgitātiō eōrum. ^ Thou hast despised all them that fall off from thy judgments
column3: for their thought is unjust.

column1: 119 ^ Praevāricantēs reputāvī omnēs peccātōrēs terrae; idiō dīlēxī testimōnia tua. ^ I have accounted all the sinners of the earth prevaricators
column2: therefore have I loved thy testimonies.

column1: 120 ^ Confīge timōre tuō carnēs meās; ā jūdiciīs enim tuīs timuī. ^ Pierce thou my flesh with thy fear
column2: for I am afraid of thy judgments.

column1: 121 ^ Fēcī jūdicium et jūstitiam; nōn trādās mē calumniantibus mē. ^ I have done judgment and justice; give me not up to them that slander me.
122 ^ Suscipe servum tuum in bonum; nōn calumnientur mē superbī. ^ Uphold thy servant unto good; let not the proud calumniate me.
123 ^ Oculī meī dēfēcērunt in salūtāre tuum
column2: et in ēloquium jūstitiae tuae. ^ My eyes have fainted after thy salvation
column3: and for the word of thy justice.

column1: 124 ^ Fac cum servō tuō secundum misericordiam tuam
column2: et jūstificātiōnēs tuās docē mē. ^ Deal with thy servant according to thy mercy
column3: and teach me thy justifications.

column1: 125 ^ Servus tuus sum egō; dā mihi intellēctum
column2: ut sciam testimōnia tua. ^ I am thy servant; give me understanding that I may know thy testimonies.
Domine; dissipāvērunt lēgem tuam. ^ It is time
column3: O Lord
column4: to act; they have dissipated thy law.

column1: 127 ^ Idiō dīlēxī mandāta tua super aurum et topāzion. ^ Therefore have I loved thy commandments above gold and the topaz.
128 ^ Proptereā ad omnia mandāta tua dīrigēbar; omnem viam inīquam odiō habuī. ^ Therefore was I directed to all thy commandments; I regarded with hated all wicked ways.
129 ^ Mīrābilia testimōnia tua; idiō scrūtāta est ea anima mea. ^ Thy testimonies are wonderful; therefore my soul hath sought them.

column2: et intellēctum dat parvulīs. ^ The declaration of thy words giveth light
column3: and giveth understanding to little ones.

column2: et attrāxī spīritum
column3: quia mandāta tua dēsīderābam. ^ I opened my mouth
column5: because I longed for thy commandments.

column2: et miserēre meī
column3: secundum jūdicium dīligentium nōmen tuum. ^ Look thou upon me
column5: according to the judgment of them that love thy name.

column1: 133 ^ Gressūs meōs dīrige secundum ēloquium tuum
column2: et nōn dominētur meī omnis injūstitia. ^ Direct my steps according to thy word
column3: and let no iniquity have dominion over me.

column2: ut custōdiam mandāta tua. ^ Redeem me from the calumnies of men
column3: that I may keep thy commandments.

column1: 135 ^ Faciem tuam illūminā super servum tuum
column2: et docē mē jūstificātiōnēs tuās. ^ Make thy face to shine upon thy servant

column2: quia nōn custōdīvērunt lēgem tuam. ^ My eyes have sent forth springs of water

column2: et rēctum jūdicium tuum. ^ Thou art just
column3: O Lord

column2: et vēritātem tuam nimis. ^ Thou hast commanded justice thy testimonies
column3: and thy truth exceedingly.

column2: quia oblītī sunt verba tua inimīcī meī. ^ My zeal hath made me pine away
column3: because my enemies forgot thy words.

column2: et servus tuus dīlēxit illud. ^ Thy word is exceedingly refined
column3: and thy servant hath loved it.

column1: 141 ^ Adolēscentulus sum egō et contemptus; jūstificātiōnēs tuās nōn sum oblītus. ^ I am very young and despised; thy justifications I did not forget.

column2: et lēx tua vēritās. ^ Thy justice is justice for ever
column3: and thy law is the truth.

column1: 143 ^ Trībulātiō et angustia invēnērunt mē; mandāta tua meditātiō mea est. ^ Trouble and anguish have found me; thy commandments are my meditation.
144 ^ Aequitās testimōnia tua in aeternum; intellēctum dā mihi
column2: et vīvam. ^ Thy testimonies are justice for ever; give me understanding
column3: and I shall live.

column2: exaudī mē
column3: Domine; jūstificātiōnēs tuās requīrem. ^ I cried with my whole heart
column5: O Lord; I will seek thy justifications.

column1: 146 ^ Clāmāvī ad tē; salvum mē fac
column2: ut custōdiam mandāta tua. ^ I cried unto thee; save me
column3: that I may keep thy commandments.

column2: et clāmāvī
column3: quia in verba tua superspērāvī. ^ I prevented the dawning of the day
column5: because in thy words I very much hoped.

column1: 148 ^ Praevēnērunt oculī meī ad tē dīlūculō
column2: ut meditārer ēloquia tua. ^ My eyes to thee have prevented the morning
column3: that I might meditate on thy words.

column1: 149 ^ Vōcem meam audī secundum misericordiam tuam Domine
column2: et secundum jūdicium tuum vīvificā mē. ^ Hear thou my voice
column3: O Lord
column5: and quicken me according to thy judgment.

column2: ā lēge autem tuā longē factī sunt. ^ They that persecute me have drawn nigh to iniquity
column3: but they are gone far off from thy law.

column2: et omnēs viae tuae vēritās. ^ Thou art near
column3: O Lord
column4: and all thy ways are truth.

column2: quia in aeternum fundāvistī ea. ^ I have known from the beginning concerning thy testimonies
column3: that thou hast founded them for ever.

column2: et ēripe mē
column3: quia lēgem tuam nōn sum oblītus. ^ See my humiliation
column5: for I have not forgotten thy law.

column2: et redime mē; propter ēloquium tuum vīvificā mē. ^ Judge my judgment
column3: and redeem me; quicken thou me for thy word's sake.

column2: quia jūstificātiōnēs tuās nōn exquīsīvērunt. ^ Salvation is far from sinners
column3: because they have not sought thy justifications.

column2: Domine; secundum jūdicium tuum vīvificā mē. ^ Many
column3: O Lord
column4: are thy mercies; quicken me according to thy judgment.

column2: et trībulant mē; ā testimōniīs tuīs nōn dēclīnāvī. ^ Many are they that persecute me and afflict me; from thy testimonies I have not declined.
quia ēloquia tua nōn custōdīvērunt. ^ I beheld the transgressors
column3: and pined away
column4: because they kept not thy word.

column2: Domine; in misericordiā tuā vīvificā mē. ^ Behold I have loved thy commandments
column3: O Lord; quicken me thou in thy mercy.

column1: 160 ^ prīncipium verbōrum tuōrum vēritās; in aeternum omnia jūdicia jūstitiae tuae. ^ The beginning of thy words is truth; all the judgments of thy justice are for ever.

column2: et ā verbīs tuīs formīdāvit cor meum. ^ Princes have persecuted me without cause
column3: and my heart hath been in awe of thy words.

column2: sīcut quī invēnit spolia multa. ^ I will rejoice at thy words
column3: as one that hath found great spoil.

column2: et abōminātus sum; lēgem autem tuam dīlēxī. ^ Iniquity I regarded with hated
column3: and I abhorred; thy law however I have loved.

column1: 164 ^ Septiēs in diē laudem dīxī tibi
column2: super jūdicia jūstitiae tuae. ^ Seven times a day I have given praise to thee
column3: for the judgments of thy justice.

column2: et nōn est illīs scandalum. ^ Much peace have they that love thy law
column3: and to them there is no stumbling block.

column2: Domine
column3: et mandāta tua dīlēxī. ^ I looked for thy salvation
column5: and I loved thy commandments.

column2: et dīlēxit ea vehementer. ^ My soul hath kept thy testimonies and hath loved them exceedingly.

column1: 168 ^ Servāvī mandāta tua et testimōnia tua
column2: quia omnēs viae meae in conspectū tuō. ^ I have kept thy commandments and thy testimonies
column3: because all my ways are in thy sight.

column1: 169 ^ Appropinquet dēprecātiō mea in conspectū tuō
column2: Domine; jūxtā ēloquium tuum dā mihi intellēctum. ^ Let my supplication
column3: O Lord
column4: come near in thy sight; give me understanding according to thy word.

column1: 170 ^ Intret postulātiō mea in conspectū tuō; secundum ēloquium tuum ēripe mē. ^ Let my request come in before thee; deliver thou me according to thy word.

column2: quum docuerīs mē jūstificātiōnēs tuās. ^ My lips shall utter a hymn
column3: when thou shalt teach me thy justifications.

column2: quia omnia mandāta tua aequitās. ^ My tongue shall pronounce thy word
column3: because all thy commandments are justice.

column1: 173 ^ Fīat manus tua ut salvet mē
column2: quoniam mandāta tua ēlēgī. ^ Let thy hand be with me to save me; for I have chosen thy precepts.
Domine
column3: et lēx tua meditātiō mea est. ^ I have longed for thy salvation
column5: and thy law is my meditation.

column2: et laudābit tē
column3: et jūdicia tua adjuvābunt mē. ^ My soul shall live
column5: and thy judgments shall help me.

column1: 176 ^ Errāvī sīcut ovis quae perīvit; quaere servum tuum
column2: quia mandāta tua nōn sum oblītus. ^ I have gone astray like a sheep that is lost; seek thy servant
column3: because I have not forgotten thy commandments.
